text: Gather the collected information from the Garmentmaker

title: Mission Description
content: Meanwhile, in the city ofOkhema, Aglaea has begun addressingNikador's infiltration. However, the political situation in Okhema appears far less stable than we had anticipated.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Remember, Aglaea, whether it be the Chrysos Heirs or the Council, our positions are entrusted to us by the people of Okhema.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Before you attempt to overreach and make decisions beyond your place, take a moment to recall the Chrysos War and what became of those "heroes."

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: If you're not well-versed in that history, have her refresh your memory.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Do not be concerned, Elder Caenis. Following the prophecy's guidance, we shall cast down the gods — in the new world, no god will stand above humankind.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Heh... I'll hold you to that promise for now.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: The pampered little girl has grown up to be a shrewd politician. Should I be pleased or concerned?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Times are changing drastically, and people must adapt. I'm not the only one committed to making a difference, Elder Caenis.

speaker: Aglaea
line: My teacher and I have other pressing matters to attend to. Please see yourself out.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Heh... I genuinely hope that at the next Council meeting, you won't be the one standing in the middle, facing the judgment.

text: Caenis sneers and departs.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy... Are you alright?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's nothing more than an empty threat, much like before — a reflection of their inner fears.

speaker: Tribbie
line: So sorry, Agy... If we were more mature, you wouldn't have to face all this alone.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Why apologize? We each have our own responsibilities.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But seeing how they give you a hard time... makes us sad, and angry...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Would you like me to slice their throats with golden threads? It would be done in a flash. All I need is your blessing, and the Council will be no more.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wh—What are you talking about!? D—Don't scare us like that, Agy!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Haha, I'm just teasing you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: I knew you were joking... You certainly have an unorthodox way of cheering people up!

speaker: Tribbie
line: However, after you said that, we somehow feel a bit better. Thank you, Agy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: We find humor in hardship because our humanity still endures.

speaker: Tribbie
line: So, about the "infiltration" Snowy mentioned earlier, did you find anything?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Don't worry. Even without their intel, I've already detected hidden currents within the city. A trivial issue, nothing I can't handle on my own.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Do you need to inform the city guards?

speaker: Aglaea
line: That would alarm Okhema's citizens. If they learn that the enemy can bypass the Chrysos Heirs and infiltrate the city, the situation might spiral out of control.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Is there anything you'd like us to help with?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's fine, Tribbie. As we discussed earlier, you need to prepare for the Blade of Fury.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We got this! Don't exhaust yourself, Agy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: (The nymphs have located the source of the disruption... I should check with the "Garmentmaker" for intel.)

text: (Talk to Tribbie, optional)

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't exhaust yourself, Agy.

text: (Talk to Garmentmaker)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Infiltration... Nikador would never resort to this if they were in their right mind.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (What exactly led to their loss of divinity? The answer lies behind the fog... I hope Castorice and that outlander can uncover the truth.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Garmentmaker, can you give me the intel the nymphs have gathered?

speaker: Aglaea
line: (The lower city... It's good that the infiltration hasn't reached the baths yet. The risk remains manageable.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (The rift must be sewn shut with golden thread before disaster occurs.)

text: Go to Marmoreal Market then find and clear three anomalies
(Idle chat)

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: What is this strange phenomenon...?

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: Should I report it to the captain?

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Something wrong?

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: ...Who goes there!?

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: L—Lady Aglaea! Wh—What brings you...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Corruption and madness are lurking behind these anomalies. I must deal with them myself to prevent further troubles.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But I don't want to alarm the public. Can I trust you, honorable guard?

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: Absolutely, Lady Aglaea! You have my solemn vow that none of this will come to light.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Thank you. If you don't mind, I will handle it from here.

speaker: Cautious Guard
line: May Kephale bless you, Lady Aglaea.

speaker: Aglaea
line: (That young guard reads between the lines well. If the end weren't so near, he would have a bright future ahead of him.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (I'd better focus on the matter at hand first...)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Show yourself, worm—

text: Hundreds of resilient golden threads reach into the corrupted void, extracting the hidden malevolence within.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's truly pathetic. A soldier stripped of all glory, lurking in the margins like a parasite.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Return to the dust, Titankin !

text: (Begin battle againstFuriae Warrior×3)
(After the battle)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (I need to ensure I leave no trace behind, so that no one suspects anything.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Time to move on to the next nymph.)

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Good day, child.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Child?

text: The girl beside you remains unresponsive.
(Oh... She's a child who can't hear.)
(Gently touch the girl's shoulder.)
(Run your fingertips through the girl's hair.)
(Hold out your arms.)
Aglaea extends her arm, signaling the girl to do the same.
The golden thread gently wraps around the girl's palm... now their hearts are connected.

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Tell me everything, child.)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (M—My knucklebone talisman fell into this really frightening place...)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (It's so dark and scary... I'm too afraid to reach in...)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Ah... I see. Don't worry, I'll help you find it.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Just do me a little favor, okay? I want you to turn around and count to thirty.)

text: You retract the threads, ready to deal with the filth before you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Show yourself, worm—

text: Hundreds of resilient golden threads reach into the corrupted void, extracting the hidden malevolence within.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Even a child's toy isn't safe from your grasp... Is greed one of your vices?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Return to the dust, wretch.

text: (Begin battle againstFuriae Philosopher×2,Furiae Archer×2)
(After the battle)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Is this what you're looking for?)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (Yes! That's it! Thank you, big sis!)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Big sis...)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (...Something on your mind, big sis?)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Nothing. But promise me you won't play on the streets alone from now on, even in Okhema.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (Your vulnerabilities will make you a target for others' malice. For many, it's easier to do wrong than to do good — believe me, I know from experience.)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (Big sis, your words are so hard to understand. I'm really confused.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (...Sorry, it seems I've forgotten how to talk to a child. Your innocence feels so distant to me now.)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (That's alright. I might not understand everything, but I still appreciate your advice. I'll be careful!)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (Oh, and by the way, you look so pretty! Just like Goddess Mnestia on the teleslate — so shiny and sparkly! Your eyes are like two beautiful gems! I'm so jealous!)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (I want you to have this knucklebone talisman, big sis. I hope it brings you luck every day and keeps you safe from bullies!)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (...Thank you, child.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (There's one more threat marked by the nymphs.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: ( Kephale , sky father, I seek your guidance... May your hand keep all things in order.)

text: (Talk to the silent girl again, optional)

speaker: Silent Girl
line: (I want you to have this knucklebone talisman, big sis. I hope it brings you luck every day and keeps you safe from bullies!)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (...Thank you, child.)

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (It's hidden in such an unassuming corner...)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (If the enemy were to infiltrate from here, the damage could be catastrophic. I'd better deal with it at once...)

text: Hundreds of resilient golden threads reach into the corrupted void, extracting from within...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: O—Ouch! Watch where you're going, will you—

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Bartholos?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: O—Oh, it's Lady Aglaea! Teehee, what a delight to see you here! Praise Phakele, every inch of your skin is glowing like the dawn itself!

speaker: Aglaea
line: How can you still mix up the sky father's name? It's Kepha—

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Never mind. I bet you did that on purpose. Tell me, Spirithief, why are you hiding in the filth?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh, it's... it's we're just trying to get rid of any threats to Okhema, haha!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: See? We turned this crazy stone monster inside into pieces with our spectacular skills, teehee!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Hmm... the traces of corruption have indeed disappeared.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: We would never dream of deceiving you, Lady Aglaea. In all of Okhema, you are the most revered—

speaker: Aglaea
line: Save the smooth talk, Spirithief... I can tell you're feeling nervous.

speaker: Aglaea
line: On second thought, since you're right here, I must ask you one more question: Where is Cipher ?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... There seems to be a misunderstanding, Lady Aglaea. Even though she and I work in the same trade, it doesn't make us allies!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: On the contrary, we're more like competitors! No competitor would want to cross paths with one another, teehee!

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Forget it. If you see her, let her know this: As demigods, we can't avoid our duties forever.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Alright, alright. Understood, Lady Aglaea! If there's nothing else, please excuse—

speaker: Aglaea
line: Wait... if my suspicion is correct, are you skulking about in the filth to keep something hidden?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Return what you've stolen, and I'll let you go.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Tsk! What rotten luck! Why did I have to bump into her...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: O venerable Zagreus , may I borrow a fragment of your fleetness?

speaker: Aglaea
line: I urge you—

speaker: Aglaea
line: How predictable... Did you truly think you could outrun me?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Teehee! It was worth a try, wasn't it?

text: The Spirithief is a (self-proclaimed) well-known master thief across Amphoreus. They enjoy stealing treasures others are just about to obtain and then vanishing into the void with their stolen goods . They tend to leave a Coin of Whimsy in mockery in the aftermath. The Spirithief is a (self-proclaimed) well-known master thief across Amphoreus. They enjoy stealing treasures others are just about to obtain and then vanishing into the void with their stolen goods . They tend to leave a Coin of Whimsy in mockery in the aftermath. The only thing that can punish them is Oronyx's power. When near a Coin of Whimsy, use the rewinding powers provided by Oronyx's Prayer upon the fissures the thief escapes through to get the Spirithief to come back. The only thing that can punish them is Oronyx's power. When near a Coin of Whimsy, use the rewinding powers provided by Oronyx's Prayer upon the fissures the thief escapes through to get the Spirithief to come back. click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller and hold to activate Oronyx's Prayer and rewind the Spirithief's time to before they escaped. However, Spirithief will struggle valiantly within the special zone. click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller and hold to activate Oronyx's Prayer and rewind the Spirithief's time to before they escaped. However, Spirithief will struggle valiantly within the special zone. While the Spirithief is in the special zone, you need to release the button to end the praying, and then click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller the button and hold when they are unprepared to bring the Spirithief to justice. While the Spirithief is in the special zone, you need to release the button to end the praying, and then click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller the button and hold when they are unprepared to bring the Spirithief to justice.
(After successfully capturing Bartholos)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Got any more tricks up your sleeve? Let's see them all.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Argh, darn it! That was so close!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Go on, take it all! Help yourself to everything I've toiled for!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Well, you got me! Even if I starve to death, nobody in this city would so much as blink an eye at my plight!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Oh, you poor thing... But you don't actually need to eat at all, do you?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Y—You heartless woman! I never want to see you again, not for all the gold in the world!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Farewell, Bartholos. Be sure to get my message to Cipher.

speaker: Aglaea
line: (All the filth marked by the nymphs has been cleansed.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: (I should go find teacher.)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Show yourself now, before golden thread is stained with your blood.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Well, well, a demigod never ceases to impress. Not even a top assassin with a lifetime of "purging" experiences can slip past you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: What are you up to, Elder Caenis?

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Drop the act. You noticed my informants a long time ago, didn't you?

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: You stayed silent to throw us off, so we'd let our guard down, while maintaining that everything you did abides by the Council's regulations — correct?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...When it comes to schemes and manipulation, Zagreus can't hold a candle to the Council.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Hehe, that's quite flattering, Chrysos Heir.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: We bear no ill will. We just want to reiterate that the Chrysos Heirs' governance of the holy city is only temporary, a provisional transfer of authority during these extraordinary times.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: While gods see and hear more extensively, mortals have their own means of dealing with things. When that so-called prophecy crumbles... the destiny of Okhema shall once again rest in the grasp of its people.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Rest in the grasp of its people... or yours, Elder Caenis?

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Ease off on the hostility. You'd do well to remember nearly half of the elders stood against entrusting the holy city to you in that crucial vote. I am but one voice in the dissent.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: Keep following your chosen path, demigod, use every bit of your power to show that we are mistaken... but don't forget for a second, in Amphoreus , even "gods" are not above the law.

speaker: Elder Caenis
line: I'm quite interested to see how long you can stick with this hands-on way of doing things... heh.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I will employ every means at my disposal to save Amphoreus, Elder Caenis. Whether it means wresting it from the grasp of the gods...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Or yours.

text: Return to the Garden of Life and tell Tribbie and the rest the situation
(Head towardsTrinnon)

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Trinnon? It seems she has begun to make arrangements for defending Okhema.

text: (Approach Trinnon)

speaker: Aglaea
line: The dangers lurking within Okhema have been eradicated. I've also cleansed the city of filth.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Thank you, Agy. That elder just now... Was she causing you trouble again?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Worry not. I'm capable of handling it, Trinnon.

speaker: Trinnon
line: You should know that during the Chrysos War, Caenis was...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...An assassin known for purging the Chrysos Heirs. I am aware.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Like I mentioned before, the Council is not our adversary... at least not now. We should be focusing on the more pressing matter at hand.

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...You're right. We've taken all possible precautions against Nikador . It... did not come easy, though... Trianne is already near her limits.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...How much of her power is left?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Taking this time into account, she should still be able to open the Century Gates three... no, maybe just two more times.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...And after that?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Tribbie will take over as the gatekeeper, according to what we've agreed on.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Waiting seems to be our only plan now.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Indeed. Let us wait here in this garden, Agy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please enlighten me, Trinnon...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission A Cleansing of Gold.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: In the world as you perceive it, does the prophecy remain as clear as it was when it first descended?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Golden runes shimmer against the azure sky, and myriad fragments of words dance around Kephale . The prophecy remains as clear as ever.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Does it foretell the triumph of Phainon and the others?

speaker: Trinnon
line: It... remains silent, seemingly cognizant of the outcome... though it's unwilling to let us in on the answer just yet.

speaker: Aglaea
line: We're not going to be finding our solace in the prophecy this time, then.

speaker: Aglaea
line: So be it. If indeed he is fate's chosen child...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...then the prophecy is nothing more than a footnote to his tale.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
